notes.text:
An update for libtiff is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libtiff packages contain a library of functions for manipulating Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) files.

Security Fix(es):

* libtiff: Heap-based buffer overflow in ChopUpSingleUncompressedStrip in tif_dirread.c (CVE-2018-15209)

* libtiff: Buffer Overflow via /libtiff/tools/tiffcrop.c (CVE-2023-25433)

* libtiff: heap-based buffer overflow in cpStripToTile() in tools/tiffcp.c (CVE-2023-6228)

* libtiff: Segment fault in libtiff  in TIFFReadRGBATileExt() leading to denial of service (CVE-2023-52356)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: ChopUpSingleUncompressedStrip in tif_dirread.c in LibTIFF 4.0.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF file, as demonstrated by tiff2pdf.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: Heap-based buffer overflow in ChopUpSingleUncompressedStrip in tif_dirread.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of libtiff as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, and 7.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: Heap-based buffer overflow in ChopUpSingleUncompressedStrip in tif_dirread.c

notes.text: An issue was found in the tiffcp utility distributed by the libtiff package where a crafted TIFF file on processing may cause a heap-based buffer overflow leads to an application crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: heap-based buffer overflow in cpStripToTile() in tools/tiffcp.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A flaw was found in tiffcrop, a program distributed by the libtiff package. A specially crafted tiff file can lead to a heap-based buffer overflow in the processCropSelections function in tools/tiffcrop.c, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

notes.text: A segment fault (SEGV) flaw was found in libtiff that could be triggered by passing a crafted tiff file to the TIFFReadRGBATileExt() API. This flaw allows a remote attacker to cause a heap-buffer overflow, leading to a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: Segment fault in libtiff  in TIFFReadRGBATileExt() leading to denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The flaw allows an attacker to potentially cause a denial of service attack by crashing a program, but the impact is minimal.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
